name: Mayor’s Youth Education and Employment Program (MYEEP)
description: MYEEP is the largest after-school youth employment program in San Francisco. At Horizons, the program provides job readiness training and employment opportunities for approximately 150 youth per annum. The program’s primary focus is to develop job skills, provide experiences that increase career awareness and future employability, increase knowledge of educational opportunities, and promote community involvement. Youth receive paid training and work experience while enrolled in the program. Duri

howToGetIt: Contact: Nancy Abdul-Shakur, Program Director (415) 487-6715 / nancy@horizons-sf.org To Apply: Online Application Eligibility - Resident of San Francisco (Mission and Potrero Hill District residence or school enrollment for Horizons’ MYEEP Program) - Currently enrolled in high school or GED program (9th or 10th grade credits) during Fall session; 14-17 during Summer session - Able to obtain a Work permit
agency: Horizons Unlimited of San Francisco, Inc
